heading: will mp3 walk over walkmans?
subheading: in a move that may push leery consumers to adopt digital music devices, both diamond multimedia and creative labs release souped-up portable mp3 players. by polly sprenger.
author: polly sprenger
text: the release of two next-generation portable mp3 audio players could speed the consumer adoption of new digital music formats and herald the end for old warhorses like the sony walkman. on monday, diamond multimedia unveiled its special edition rio mp3 player -- with styling suspiciously similar to that other consumer computing success, the imac. and creative labs on monday showed off the first release of its nomad mp3 player."it's clear that there's hot competition in this space," said steve grady, vice president of marketing at goodnoise, a seller of downloadable mp3 files. "these guys are working at leapfrogging each other. it will move the technology forward really quickly."read ongoing mp3 coverage
